page.title: 16Johnstone Personality
page.content: We were visting the Thorn Brae in Johnstone when we met Jim Leighton; the Scotland and Aberdeen football team goalkeeper, and former Saint Cuthbert's pupil. We asked him if he enjoyed the previous night's World Cup game against Iceland. He told us he enjoyed the game very much, and that he had arrived home that morning and was still feeling sleepy. I asked him how he enjoyed the penalty save against Iceland and he said that he knew where the ball was going. Before going to Aberdeen, Jim played for Johnstone United; the local under 16's boys football club. Mr Bryant took a photograph of the "Team" and Jim Leighton.
